desc: Just before midnight June 22, an off-duty police officer radios that he is in a foot chase with a suspect through Monroe Place Apartments.
Officer James Burns arrives minutes later. He disables his blue lights and siren.
Burns turns onto Monroe Place NE and slows his vehicle as he scans the area.
Deravis Rogers, who is parked toward the end of the block, turns on his lights and drives north.
Seeing the approaching vehicle, Burns angles his car towards the center of the road, chirps his siren and turns on his blue lights.
The car continues north without stopping. Burns said he thought the driver was trying to escape.
As the car tries to drive around Burns' patrol vehicle, the officer jumps out and yells "Stop!"
Burns runs toward the rear of his vehicle. He fires one shot through Rogers' passenger side window, striking him in the head.
Rogers' car coasts down Monroe Place, hops the curb of Monroe Drive, and crashes into a vehicle in a parking lot. Rogers is later pronounced dead.
